title: North Carolina had a housing crisis before Hurricane Helene; now it's even worse
description: Hurricanes have gotten larger and wetter because of climate change and inland communities are at greater risk from heavy flooding. That's what Hurricane Helene did to western North Carolina last year.
content:
FAIRVIEW, N.C. Before Hurricane Helene last September, Stuart and Jackie Pacheo's home was wedged between the highway and a small creek in this town just outside Asheville.
